com.tools.jtail

Class Options

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tools.jtail.Options

  • public class Options
extends java.lang.Object
    Parsing command line options and provide switches to the rest of the program.

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static java.util.List<java.lang.String> files()
      Returns the list of filenames provided in the command line.
      static boolean follow()
      output appended data as the file grows; -f, --follow, and --follow=descriptor are equivalent.
      static boolean fromBeginning()
      Indicates we wish to follow/see the file from the beginning of the x lines or x bytes, instead of the last x lines or x bytes in the file.
      static java.lang.Long getBytes()
      output the last K bytes; alternatively, use -c +K to output bytes starting with the Kth of each file
      static java.lang.String getFile(int i)
      Returns the filename at position i in the list of filenames provided on the command line.
      static java.lang.Long getLines()
      output the last K lines, instead of the last 10; or use -n +K to output lines starting with the Kth
      static int getNumberOfFiles()
      Returns the number of files entered at the command line.
      static void parse(java.lang.String[] args) 
      static java.lang.Long pid()
      (NOT IMPLEMENTED) with -f, terminate after process ID, PID dies.
      static void printHelp()
      Print the help to System.out.
      static boolean retry()
      keep trying to open a file even when it is or becomes inaccessible; useful when following by name, i.e., with --follow=name
      static boolean showFilenames()
      Show headers containing the filename when new information becomes available.
      static boolean showHelp()
      Do we need to show the help?
      static boolean showVersion()
      Do we need to show the version?
      static java.lang.Long sleep()
      With -f and -old, sleep for approximately N seconds (default 1.0) between iterations.
      static boolean usePolling()
      Use polling the filesystem (old) instead of letting the filesystem tell us if anything's(new) changed.

      • usePolling

        public static boolean usePolling()
        Use polling the filesystem (old) instead of letting the filesystem tell us if anything's(new) changed.
        Returns:
        true, use the old way. False otherwise.
        See Also:
        FileSystemWatcher

      • showVersion

        public static boolean showVersion()
        Do we need to show the version?

        public static boolean follow()
        output appended data as the file grows; -f, --follow, and --follow=descriptor are equivalent.
        Returns:

      • pid

        public static java.lang.Long pid()
        (NOT IMPLEMENTED) with -f, terminate after process ID, PID dies.
        Returns:

      • sleep

        public static java.lang.Long sleep()
        With -f and -old, sleep for approximately N seconds (default 1.0) between iterations. With inotify and --pid=P, check process P at least once every N seconds.
        Returns:
        number of seconds to sleep. Default is 1 second.

      • retry

        public static boolean retry()
        keep trying to open a file even when it is or becomes inaccessible; useful when following by name, i.e., with --follow=name
        Returns:
